Posts.Content: Apr 16, 2012 01:23AM janicemarie3 wrote: I had the same issue acne and itchy scalp.  The oncologist reduced my dose and it has cleared up completely.  I see the oncologist on friday to see if he is going to increase my dose back up.  I hope you find some relief it is awful.
Posts.Title: Tykerb Face! lynne248 CoolBreeze

Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2011 03:37PM janicemarie3 wrote: Windy, I am so sorry you have to go through this.  My experience is very much like yours.  I found out on December 30th 2009 that I had breast cancer.  The doctor scheduled a PET scan I had a mastectomy scheduled for January 7th 2010, when I arrived for my surgery they told me that the cancer had spread to my bones.  I started chemo instead that day.  I dont think that your fears ever go away. They are always in the back of your mind.  It took me a long time to get over the shock of everything happening so fast.  I joined a support group in my community and that seemed to help a little bit.  If you ever want to talk you can private message me.

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2010 02:28AM janicemarie3 wrote: I have 9 and 6 year old daughters and a 2 year old boy my daughters understood but had a lot of questions.  I told the that I had bad cell in my body and I needed to take medicine to get rid of the bad cells.  I told them that the medicine would make my hair fall out but it would grow back after I was done with the medicine.  It was so cute after my hair fell out our 2 year old would come up to me and rub my head and say mommas pretty's it was so cute.  Children can adapt very well to things.  I just try to keep things as normal as possible.   Hope everything goes smoothly for you.

Posts.Content: Jan 7, 2012 10:48PM janicemarie3 wrote: I have been on Herceptin for the past 2 years every three weeks.  I have had my port for the past 2 years also.  I had a littke discomfort at first but no I hardly even notice it is there.  I have had no problems with my port the chemo nurses are the only ones that I let touch it.  I also get my heart function checked every 3 months with an echocardiogram. I have had no problems I drink alot of water on the day of the infusion and have no side effects.  I think that you will come to find that you port will be your best friend when it comes to infusions.  Good Luck with everything.  Janice

Posts.Title: PET Results CoolBreeze ruthbru

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2011 01:19PM janicemarie3 wrote: Vanessa I completely understsand what you are going through.  I was diagnosed with bone mets on January 7th 2010.  This was my first diagnosis.  In february of this year I found two lumps in my right breast where the cancer was found the first time.  The doctor ordered a CT scan and it showed that it was cancer.  I am estrogen positive the doctor put me on Arimidex for 5 weeks and it did make the tumors shrink.  So I didn't have to go back on chemo right now.  I will continue on arimidex herceptin and zometa.  My doctor also said that because I am Stage IV already a mastectomy would not make sense.  I wish you thebest of luck on your scans.  You and your family are in my thoughts and prayers.

Posts.Title: PET Results CoolBreeze ruthbru

Posts.Content: Sep 26, 2010 04:52PM janicemarie3 wrote: I was on Taxotere and Carboplatin and I drank alot of water it really helped me with the pain.  I did 6 cycles of these.  I did however have my bad days.  They were usually the 3 or 4th day and they would last a couple of days.  But I really think that the water helped alot.  I would usually drink 6 bottles of water a day.  I hope you find some relief from your pain.  The results I had on Taxotere where very good.  My tumor in my right breast was 7cm.  and by the time I finished  my 6 cycles the doctor couldn't fell my tumor anymore.
Posts.Title: Crazy Bone Pain - started Taxotere and Rads last week LivingIt sunnydaze

Posts.Content: Oct 26, 2010 11:55PM janicemarie3 wrote: i know how you feel.  When I was first diagnosed I would go on the internet and try and find all the information I could about Stage IV.  But the statistics are really frightening. I wanted to know how much time I had left with my kids and family, but now after 10 months I am now forgetting about the statistics and know that for right now I am feeling good and that everyone is different.  It just breaks my heart knowing that my children have to go through this. It is not wrong to want a definite answer I think that everyone here would want the same,  I know I do.  I tried the youngsurvivors too and didn't really care for it.  Hope you have a good week.

Posts.Content: Nov 6, 2010 05:36PM janicemarie3 wrote: Edancer I am so sorry to hear that your lymph nodes were positive.  You will be in my thoughts and prayers on Monday.  I never had to have the mastectomy,  I was scehduled for one and when I showed up for it they told my that the PET scan I had showed that the cancer had spread to my bones.  So I started chemo on that day instead.  The chemo is not as bad as I was expecting it to be. After it is all done the time really does fly by fast.  I really hope that you have a speedy recovery from all of you surgeries.

Posts.Content: May 31, 2011 09:37AM janicemarie3 wrote: I had taxotere Carboplatin and Herceptin.  6 cycles every 21 days.  The side effects that I had were fatigue and body aches usually occuring on the four day that last about 4 days.  I drank alot of water while I was taking this drug.  It was very effective for me.  My tumor was 7 cm and at the end it no longer showed up on the scans.
